alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 18 at 8:17PM CDT until March 23 at 11:49PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Forks ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. .Snowmelt runoff is making its way into the Snake River. Reaches its initial peak after the 20th of March. For the Snake River...including Alvarado...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snake River AT Alvarado. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 106.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. Storm sewer flood gates are closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Friday the stage was 98.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Sunday afternoon to a crest of 107.0 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 106.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late Saturday night at 230 AM CDT.
